Therefore, I am the only one who has come to see you.

12820.text:
And you will have come to you today, grateful.
Visrabdho me Davijasreshtha about you.

12821.text:
For we have all the virtues bought in particular
Yas tava self-interested things, and you are following me here.

12822.text:
[Barahman]
I have come, O greatly fortunate one, longing to see you.
Kam chid artham anarthajnah parastu kamo bhujangam

12823.text:
I am the self-realized soul in the self, the self-interest.
I worship the great wise man who is a dwelling place.

12824.text:
Parakashitas tavam savgunaira yasho garbhagabhastibhih
The touch of the moon’s hand is self-revelated by the hearts of the hearts.

12825.text:
Tasya me parashnam aritnam chindhi tavam anilashan
I will tell you the work afterwards you can rescue me

12826.text:
[Brahman]
विवस्वतॊ गच्छति पर्ययेण;वॊढुं भवांस तं रथम एकचक्रम
आश्चर्यभूतं यदि तत्र किं चिद;दृष्टं तवया शंसितुम अर्हसि तवम

12827.text:
[Nag]
whose branches are like birds in thousands of rays
The sages, who were perfected by the gods, relying on the dwelling place.

12828.text:
Because the wind emerged and the sun’s rays were great
What a wonderful thing then is the brahmin in the sky

12829.text:
Shukra Namasita Paro Yasya Varidhara Amabare
What is the surprise in the rains that creates the rain

12830.text:
The milk that is released by the pure ray of the 'Asatamasasa
What is the surprise of the time again in time.

12831.text:
whose splendor is always present in the special souls
Because the seed is the earth and the moving and the unmoving is held

12832.text:
where the god, the mighty-armed, the eternal, the supreme, the income
The eternal death, the brahmin, what is the surprise?

12833.text:
I’m surprised as the wonders, but listen to me.
Vimale yan I have seen the sun in the sky

12834.text:
Pura midday time the world burns in the sun
The light of the sun afterwards appears everywhere

12835.text:
Sa lokans tejasa sarvabhasa nirvibhayana
as if he were throwing the sky to be fearless

12836.text:
Hutahutir iva jayotir vayapte tejo marichibhih
The sun is like a davitiya in an indefinable form

12837.text:
His approach is given to him in the parapti, Vivasvata.
Therefore, the right hand gave the other worship to the worshiper

12838.text:
Then he breaks the sky and the sun-god.
and the unity of that light is the sun by the kashana.

12839.text:
There is our praise in the confluence of the thyos tejas
Whoever comes to the sun in the chariot of the other

12840.text:
They are the ones born of doubt, O Ravim.
Who is this heavenly attack and gone like the sun.

12841.text:
[sun]
This is not the god, the friend of the wind, nor the demon, nor the serpent.
Unchvritti varate siddha munira esha divam gata

12842.text:
This is the root-fruit-eater and the harvest-leaf food.
Abbhaksha and Vayubhakshasha were the brahmins concentrated

12843.text:
Richash chanena vipra samhita samhita abhistutah
The heavens have gone to the heavens by which he has gone to the heavens

12844.text:
Asann dhiranaankasi nityaam unchashilashanah
This is the brahmin who is endowed with the welfare of all beings

12845.text:
There are no gods, no Gandharvas, no demons, no serpents
They are the ultimate destination of the beings who have attained the other

12846.text:
[Nag]
This is the surprise I have seen there, Davij
The perfected human body who has gone to perfection
The Brahman changes the earth with the sun

12847.text:
[Brahman]
Wonder is there no doubt, well-pleased, smiling serpent.
I have also shown the path in words that have gone in the end

12848.text:
Savasti te 'satu go I will go, O Sadhu, the best of the serpents.
Samaraniyo 'sami bhatava samprashan niyojanaih

12849.text:
[Nag]
Without saying the work in Me, you are the other who stands in the Kavedani.
Tell me, Davija, what I have come here for for what you have done.

12850.text:
Inviting me in the work for the above-mentioned, Davijarshabha
I have permitted you to go there, then you will go, Barahmana

12851.text:
Not only when I saw me and gave it to you here.
You deserve to go, O brahmin, as you have at the root of a tree.

12852.text:
I am yours, O Davija, you are no doubt in me.
This world is all your worry about me, O sinless one.

12853.text:
[Barahman]
Evam etan mahaprajna vijnatarthabhujangam
There are no gods in all respects in all respects

12854.text:
What I am that is yours and this is the serpent
I am the part and all beings are always the cows everywhere

12855.text:
There was a doubt in my Bhogapate, in the accumulation of merit
So I’ll be able to walk in the unshavrata, Sadhu, Arthadarshana.

12856.text:
This is my certainty, the saintly one, the cause and effect.
I invite you well, I’ll be satisfied with your purpose, O serpent.

12857.text:
[Bhism]
He is the eldest of the mantra and the eldest of the Brahmins.
The initiate then Rajansha Chayavana Bhargava Sharita

12858.text:
He had done the rituals by him and stood there
And so did the story, O king, then.

12859.text:
Even by Bhargava, O King, in the residence of Janaka.
This story is told to the great sage Narada

12860.text:
Narada also in the residence of Rajendra Devendra
It is said, O best of the Bharatas, by the uncomplicated action.

12861.text:
And the king of the gods was told in the past.
O lord of the earth, to all others, to the Vasus.

12862.text:
And when my Rama had a battle, he was very fierce
Vasubhisha then, O king, I have told me what I have told you.

12863.text:
I have asked you in fact, O lord of the worlds.
This is said, the holy, the righteous, the righteous, the best of the righteous.

12864.text:
That is this supreme religion which you ask me, India
Asann Dhirnakanski Dharmarthakarane Nripa

12865.text:
He is also a determination of the Davijagrya;Bhujag husband-represented meaning action
Yama is the rule of the forest-contained forest.The rocks of the countless
